xxl.core.pipes.sources
Class RandomNumber<T extends Number>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource<T>
          xxl.core.pipes.sources.RandomNumber<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Source<T>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class RandomNumber<T extends Number>
extends AbstractSource<T>

Source component in a query graph that produces a (finite or infinite) stream of randomly distributed elements. The user is able to specify a ContinuousRandomWrapper or DiscreteRandomWrapper for full flexibility, e.g. the Colt library may be accessed using these wrappers. The constants CONTINUOUS and DISCRETE of this class also offer an easy way to use Java's standard pseudo random number generators (PRNGs).

Example usage (1): 

        new VisualSink(new RandomNumber(RandomNumber.DISCRETE, 100), true);
Returns an infinite stream of uniformly distributed discrete random numbers with a fixed output rate of 10 elements per second.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
ContinuousRandomWrapper, DiscreteRandomWrapper, JavaContinuousRandomWrapper, JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper, SourceProcessor

RandomNumber

public RandomNumber(SourceProcessor processor,
                    ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                    long noOfElements)
Creates a new source producing a finite stream of continuous random numbers with a user-defined processor simulating its activity.

Parameters:
processor - The thread simulating this source's activity.
crw - The ContinuousRandomWrapper used to generate continuous random numbers.
noOfElements - The length of the resulting stream.

RandomNumber

public RandomNumber(ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                    long noOfElements,
                    long period)
Creates a new source producing a finite stream of continuous random numbers with a fixed output rate.

Parameters:
crw - The ContinuousRandomWrapper used to generate continuous random numbers.
noOfElements - The length of the resulting stream.
period - The delay between two successive elements in the resulting stream.

RandomNumber

public RandomNumber(boolean TYPE,
                    long period)
Creates a new source producing an infinite stream of random numbers with a fixed output rate depending on the specified type: DISCRETE or CONTINUOUS.
Java's standard pseudo random number generators (PRNGs) are used.

Parameters:
TYPE - The type of random numbers: DISCRETE or CONTINUOUS.
period - The delay between two successive elements in the resulting stream.

period - The delay between two succesive elements in the resulting stream.
Method Detail

next

public T next()
                      throws NoSuchElementException
Depending on the type of random numbers to be transferred, this method requests a new one from the corresponding RandomWrapper. If a finite stream is produced, a NoSuchElementException is thrown, when the specified number of elements is exceeded.

Specified by:
next in class AbstractSource<T extends Number>
Returns:
The next random number that is emitted by this source.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - If the specified number of elements is exceeded.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
